segment.source: Configuring App-V Administration for a Distributed Environment
segment.target: Configuring App-V Administration for a Distributed Environment

segment.source: Configuring App-V Administration for a Distributed Environment
segment.target: Configuring App-V Administration for a Distributed Environment

segment.source: Configuring App-V Administration for a Distributed Environment
segment.target: Configuring App-V Administration for a Distributed Environment

segment.source: When designing the infrastructure for your specific organization, you can install the App-V Management Web Service on a computer other than the computer where you install the App-V Management Server.
segment.target: When designing the infrastructure for your specific organization, you can install the App-V Management Web Service on a computer other than the computer where you install the App-V Management Server.

segment.source: Common reasons for separating these App-V components include the following:
segment.target: Common reasons for separating these App-V components include the following:

segment.source: Performance
segment.target: Performance

segment.source: Reliability
segment.target: Reliability

segment.source: Availability
segment.target: Availability

segment.source: Scalability
segment.target: Scalability

segment.source: Separating the Management Server and Management Web Service requires additional configuration for the infrastructure to operate correctly.
segment.target: Separating the Management Server and Management Web Service requires additional configuration for the infrastructure to operate correctly.

segment.source: When you separate these two features but do not complete the procedures described in this topic, the Management Console will connect to the Management Web Service but will not be able to properly authenticate with the data store.
segment.target: When you separate these two features but do not complete the procedures described in this topic, the Management Console will connect to the Management Web Service but will not be able to properly authenticate with the data store.

segment.source: The Management Console will not load properly, and the administrator will not be able to complete any administrative tasks.
segment.target: The Management Console will not load properly, and the administrator will not be able to complete any administrative tasks.

segment.source: This behavior occurs because the Management Web Service cannot use the credentials, passed to it from the Management Console, to access the data store.
segment.target: This behavior occurs because the Management Web Service cannot use the credentials, passed to it from the Management Console, to access the data store.

segment.source: The solution is to configure the Management Web Service server to be “Trusted for delegation.”
segment.target: The solution is to configure the Management Web Service server to be “Trusted for delegation.”

segment.source: Configuring Active Directory Domain Services
segment.target: Configuring Active Directory Domain Services

segment.source: It is also necessary to configure Active Directory Domain Services properly to work in a distributed environment.
segment.target: It is also necessary to configure Active Directory Domain Services properly to work in a distributed environment.

segment.source: This section includes the information you need configure Active Directory Domain Services.
segment.target: This section includes the information you need configure Active Directory Domain Services.

segment.source: When SQL Service Uses Local System account
segment.target: When SQL Service Uses Local System account

segment.source: To set up the environment where the SQL Service uses the local system account, change the properties of the machine account of the Management Web Service to be trusted for delegation.
segment.target: To set up the environment where the SQL Service uses the local system account, change the properties of the machine account of the Management Web Service to be trusted for delegation.

segment.source: For detailed procedures about how to do this, see How to Configure the Server to be Trusted for Delegation
segment.target: For detailed procedures about how to do this, see How to Configure the Server to be Trusted for Delegation

segment.source: When SQL Service Uses Domain-Based Account
segment.target: When SQL Service Uses Domain-Based Account

segment.source: To set up the environment where SQL Servers use domain-based service accounts, you need to consider whether or not a variety of factors apply, including the following:
segment.target: To set up the environment where SQL Servers use domain-based service accounts, you need to consider whether or not a variety of factors apply, including the following:

segment.source: Clustering of SQL Server
segment.target: Clustering of SQL Server

segment.source: Replication
segment.target: Replication

segment.source: Automated tasks
segment.target: Automated tasks

segment.source: Linked servers
segment.target: Linked servers

segment.source: For information about configuring Active Directory Domain Services when the SQL service uses a domain-based account, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151968.
segment.target: For information about configuring Active Directory Domain Services when the SQL service uses a domain-based account, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151968.
